title: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in a bottle of wine (standard 750 ml), including carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for red vs. white, plus quick nutrition breakdown.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine, ~12.5% ABV, no added sugars or fortification.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (red/white/sweet), alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine has about 625 kcal, mostly from alcohol and residual sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine bottle.

faqs.q: Calories in a glass from a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: Roughly 125 kcal per 150 ml glass (5 glasses per bottle).

faqs.q: Does white wine have fewer calories than red?
faqs.a: Slightlyâ€”dry white is ~575 kcal per bottle vs. 625 for red.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: Yes, about 20 g total, mostly from residual sugars and alcohol-derived carbs.

faqs.q: How does wine alcohol affect calories?
faqs.a: Alcohol contributes ~7 kcal per gram; a 12.5% ABV bottle has ~90 g alcohol, adding ~630 kcal total.
